subject: Re: [junit] Is there any logging facility in jUnit?
msgSnippet: The simple solution is to print to standard error. This is of limited use with the GUI test runner. The better solution is to use a logging package. The apache

The simple solution is to print to standard error. This is of limited use
with the GUI test runner.

The better solution is to use a logging package. The apache project has a
decent logging package. We also have our own (http://qcijutils.qlue.com).
The latest source tree for our package contains a LoggerTestCase that your
tests can inherit from. LoggerTestcase creates a local logger, collects
the output, and dumps it in labelled files in a "testrun" directory.
LoggerTestCase can easily collect output from the code under test as well.

On Mon, 22 Oct 2001, Bret Waldow wrote:

> If I want to put messages from my test into the output of jUnit (perhaps
> only in the text ui, for instance) is there a call to allow this?  I haven't
> found one yet.
>
> Of course, jUnit puts all it's own messages out, and any exceptions that are
> thrown, but how about just log messages?
>
> regards,
> Bret
